授業目的: This class aims to understand the relationships between the economy and religion in Europe, reconsidering the European historical events, sacred scriptures, and economic thought and comparing to Japanese religious and economic development.
到達目標: Students can discuss the reasons why global and social issues are related to religions not only in Europe, but also in the world.
授業方法: We have both face to face lectures and workshops by students

第1回: Introduction to topics of religion and economy
第2回: Comparisons of the European and Japanese religions
第3回: Economic practices and thoughts in Christianity 1
第4回: Economic practices and thoughts in Christianity 2
第5回: Economic practices and thoughts in Judaism and Islam
第6回: Crusade as a form of the free market
第9回: economic and religious practices in the pre-modern era in Japan
第10回: Comparison of religious practices in the pre-modern era
第12回: Adam Smith's thought as a last religious reformist
第14回: Reconsideration of global issues related to religions

European Studies:
1. Understanding and analytical skills regarding international issues: the ability to understand and analyze various regions of the world from different perspectives in the humanities and social sciences.
2. Problem-solving skills: the ability to proactively identify problems and solve them based on appropriate methods.
3. Intercultural understanding and multicultural coexistence: the ability to be sensitive to different cultures and to coexist with diverse cultures.
